name: Extreme Cold
description: Environmental hazard from temperatures at or below 0 degrees Fahrenheit that causes exhaustion
trigger: Being exposed to temperatures of 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower
duration: ongoing while exposed to extreme cold

ongoing: Constitution saving throw at end of each hour
Gain 1 Exhaustion level on failed save

automatic: Creatures with Resistance to Cold damage
Creatures with Immunity to Cold damage

relatedHazards.name: Frigid Water
relatedHazards.duration: Minutes equal to Constitution score before ill effects
relatedHazards.effect: After that duration, DC 10 Constitution save each additional minute or gain 1 Exhaustion level
relatedHazards.immunity: Creatures with Resistance/Immunity to Cold, or naturally adapted to ice-cold water

relatedHazards.name: Slippery Ice
relatedHazards.effect: Moving onto slippery ice or starting turn there requires DC 10 Dexterity save or have Prone condition

relatedHazards.name: Thin Ice
relatedHazards.description: Ice with weight tolerance of 3d10 x 10 pounds per 10-foot square
relatedHazards.effect: When weight exceeded, ice breaks and creatures fall into frigid water below

detection.method: Feel temperature, see environmental signs (frost, ice, snow)

mitigation: Use magical warmth (Endure Elements, Create Bonfire)
Have Resistance or Immunity to Cold damage (automatic success on saves)
Travel during warmer parts of day if possible

additionalEffects: Heavy snowfall creates Lightly Obscured areas
High altitude (10,000+ feet) doubles travel time due to thin air
Strong wind can create blizzard conditions

tacticalConsiderations: Plan shorter travel segments to allow for rest and warming
Consider magical protection for extended cold exposure
Rest periods don't stop exposure - need actual shelter
Multiple party members may need rescue if Exhaustion accumulates

srdReference.quote: When the temperature is 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower, a creature exposed to the extreme cold must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw at the end of each hour or gain 1 Exhaustion level. Creatures that have Resistance or Immunity to Cold damage automatically succeed on the save.

examples: Trekking across frozen tundra - hourly CON saves
Camping in arctic conditions - continue saves even when resting
Exploring ice cavern without cold protection
Magical blizzard created by winter hag
Plane of Ice adventure without proper preparation
Climbing frozen mountain in winter storm
